name: Sid Meier's Colonization (Classic)
description: The New World lies before you with all its peril, promise and infinite possibility. Your colonists anxiously follow you to shore. The treasures of an entire continent await you.

reviews.review_text: I love Sid Meier's older games! Thumbs this post up if you wish Steam had a version of the original Sid Meier's Civilization for DOS!

A nice trip back in time. Surprised to see that 90% of games today are worse than a game from 1994. So far I had 12 hours of gameplay for less than 1 euro. If u like good classic strategy games. Get it.

Along with Sid Meier's Civilization, this is among of my favorite strategy games of the early-to-mid 90's, and I'm delighted to see it on Steam. While the game may seem dated or boring to some, there's a lot of freedom to play the game the way you see fit. Want to be a mostly peaceful trader? Attack natives and/or other European powers to expand as far and wide as possible? Revolt against the monarchy and declare independence? Some combination of the above? Go for it.  Yes, this game runs in DOSBox. If that's a problem for you, or if the graphics prevent you from wanting to play, FreeCol or Civilization IV: Colonization might be better alternatives. Nostalgia always draws me back to the original, but I understand this game shows its age and might not be for everyone. If you do give it a shot, be sure to reference the player guide and the in-game Colonizopedia,.. otherwise at least pay attention to the help screens and try to figure it out on your own. Happy colonizing!

One of my favorite DOS games and strategy games ever, its a fun and more condensed version of Civilization, focusing more on economy supply and demand and trading.  ALSO the game comes with an ISO that has a ♥♥♥♥ing Windows 98-compatible version of Colonization for Windows, which is virtually the same game but with much higher resolution graphics and CD audio soundtrack. For this alone, I cannot recommend this enough, what a stellar release.

Works well on yosemite, perfect flashback to the 90s.

This is Civilization I but on a more intimate scale. The unique challenge posed in this game, the one of actually declaring your independance and fighting for it, is a challenge indeed. There never seems to be enough of everything to go around, so learning to make do with a shoe-string effort seems to be the norm. I have supremely fond memories of the game and I'm glad to say the game has held up to those all these years later. Warning: prepare to find yourself humming songs from the game for the next few years.

This was one of the first games I bought for my daughter's (new Hewlet Packard Win 3.1) computer for Christmas in 1994. I cannot tell you how much fun and how many hours we played this game, and here it is in it's entirity. Have to adjust resolution because as with most old DOS games, it's too grainy to play and enjoy above 800 res, but this is a classic properly brought back to life on Steam. In the common folder for the game is the maual which will make playing much more comfortable. At the sale price, it was a buy. Thanks steam, fond memories. worth playing again.

This is the kind of game that you need to plan your entire day around, because once you start to play you will click in at least 5 hours!  I like everything about this game, the gameplay, the game design, the graphics, the soundtrack: I find everything soothing and captivating.

A disgusting remake of a great game. This new version is almost totally different from the original. My only connection to thid gsme is my attempt to get a refund. Recommend you do not waste your time and money.
